quote_first: And then Wedderburn looked at his watch. "
quote_last: . I am going up by the quarter to twelve train, so that there is plenty of time. I think I shall wear my alpaca jacket - it is quite warm enough - and my grey felt hat and brown shoes.”
title: The Flowering of The Strange Orchid
author: H.G. Wells

quote_first: It comprised all that was required of the servant, from eight in the morning, exactly at which hour Phileas Fogg rose, till half-past eleven, when he left the house for the Reform Club - all the details of service, the tea and toast at
quote_last: , the shaving-water at thirty-seven minutes past nine, and the toilet at twenty minutes before ten.
title: Around the World in Eighty Days
author: Jules Verne

quote_last: Thus says the Lord of hosts: In those days ten men from the nations of every tongue shall take hold of the robe of a Jew, saying, ‘Let us go with you, for we have heard that God is with you.’”
title: Zechariah
author: ESV
